signature_matches.description: Has permission to write to the SMS storage
Scans for WIFI networks

Has permission to query the current location
Uses the DexClassLoader (often used for code injection)
Uses HTTPS

Reads shares settings

Loads native libraries
Has permission to read the SMS storage
Installs a new wake lock (to get activate on phone screen on)
Found suspicious command strings (may be related to BOT commands)
Has permission to mount or unmount file systems (removable storage)
Monitors incoming SMS
Acquires a wake lock
Attempts to mount system partition as writable
Creates SQLiteDatabase table
Checks an internet connection is available
Accesses external storage location
Tries to change file permissions on the native system using chmod
Sets a repeating alarm
Has permission to read the default browser history
Removes its application launcher (likely to stay hidden)
Contains 'BusyBox' related behavior (Linux command bundle)
Classification label
Has permission to record audio in the background
Requests potentially dangerous permissions
Monitors outgoing Phone calls
Has an unnatural receiver priority (often indicator for malware)
Has permission to take photos
Has permissions to monitor, redirect and/or block calls
Requests to ignore battery optimizations
Unable to instrument or execute APK, no dynamic information has been logged
Queries the phones location (GPS)
Opens an internet connection
Queries the network operator name
Aborts a broadcast event (this is often done to hide phone events such as incoming SMS)
Has permissions to create, read or change account settings (inlcuding account password settings)
Registers a Sensor listener (to get data about accelerometer, gyrometer etc.)
Has permission to receive SMS in the background
Lists and deletes files in the same context
Creates files
Enables or disables WIFI
Has permission to read contacts
Uses HTTP for connecting to the internet
Connects to IPs without corresponding DNS lookups
Accesses the audio/media managers
Has permission to draw over other applications or user interfaces
Queries the unqiue device ID (IMEI, MEID or ESN)
Accesses /proc
Has permission to read the phones state (phone number, device IDs, active call ect.)
Kills/terminates processes
URLs found in memory or binary data
Has permission to read the call log
Starts/registers a service/receiver on device admin enabled
Accesses android OS build fields
Executes native commands
Checks partitions
Monitors network connection state
Queries the network MAC address
Has permission to change the WIFI configuration including connecting and disconnecting
Performs DNS lookups (Java API)
Records audio/media
Queries camera information
Queries the network operator numeric MCC+MNC (mobile country code + mobile network code)
May try to detect the virtual machine to hinder analysis (VM artifact strings found in memory)
Queries several sensitive phone informations
Has permission to send SMS in the background
Queries the unique operating system id (ANDROID_ID)
Has permission to query the list of currently running applications
Reads the serial number of the device
Queries the WIFI MAC address
Uses Crypto APIs
Has permission to execute code after phone reboot
Uses reflection
Contains a screen recorder (to take screenshot)

ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET INFO Android Device Connectivity Check
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert http $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET INFO Android Device Connectivity Check"; flow:established,to_server; urilen:13; http.method; content:"GET"; http.uri; content:"/generate_204"; fast_pattern; endswith; http.host; content:"connectivitycheck.gstatic.com"; http.accept_enc; content:"gzip"; depth:4; endswith; http.header_names; content:!"Cache"; content:!"Referer"; classtype:misc-activity; sid:2036220; rev:4; metadata:affected_product Android, attack_target Mobile_Client, created_at 2018_09_14, deployment Perimeter, deployment Internal, former_category INFO, performance_impact Low, signature_severity Informational, tag Connectivity_Check, updated_at 2020_09_16;)
